name: Introduction to Science Journalism
description: This course introduces students to the fundamentals of science journalism. Topics include writing for a variety of media and audiences, exploring ethical issues, and understanding the impact of science journalism on society. Students will gain a basic understanding of the principles of science journalism.

name: Research Methods for Science Journalism
description: This course will teach students how to effectively research and write about science topics. Students will develop skills in conducting interviews, analyzing data, and researching the latest science trends. The course will also introduce students to various forms of scientific writing, with a focus on writing for print, broadcast, and online media.

name: Science Journalism and the Law
description: This course will focus on the legal aspects of science journalism. The course will explore libel laws, freedom of information laws, copyright laws, and intellectual property laws. Students will learn how to protect themselves and their work from legal action. The course will also provide an overview of the current state of the media industry, including defamation and privacy laws.

name: Science Journalism in the Digital Age
description: This course will explore the impact of digital technologies on science journalism. Topics include the use of social media, blogging, and podcasting to report news, as well as emerging trends in online science journalism. Students will gain a basic understanding of digital tools and techniques, and will learn how to create effective and engaging digital content.
